name: src/tree.js

properties.name: parent
properties.description: if not provided then will traverse tree to find parent

params.name: element
params.description: if a string is provided, it calls document.querySelector(element)

params.name: tree
params.description: data for tree (see readme for description)

params.name: options.indentation
params.description: number of pixels to indent for each level

params.name: options.threshold
params.description: number of pixels to move to start a drag

params.name: options.holdTime
params.description: number of milliseconds before name can be edited (set to 0 to disable)

params.name: options.expandOnClick
params.description: expand and collapse node on click without drag except (will select before expanding if select=true)

params.name: options.classBaseName
params.description: first part of className for all DOM objects (e.g., yy-tree, yy-tree-indicator)

params.name: options.addStyles
params.description: attaches a style sheet with default and overridden styles; set to false to use your own stylesheet

params.name: styles.nameStyles
params.description: use these to override individual styles for the name (will be included in the attached stylesheet)

params.name: styles.contentStyles
params.description: use these to override individual styles for the content (will be included in the attached stylesheet)

params.name: styles.indicatorStyles
params.description: use these to override individual styles for the move-line indicator (will be included in the attached stylesheet)

params.name: styles.selectedStyles
params.description: use these to override individual styles for the selected item (will be included in the attached stylesheet)

name: update
description: call this after tree's data has been updated outside of this library

name: editData
description: edit the name entry using the data

name: edit
description: edit the name entry using the created element

name: nameChange
description: change the name of a leaf

name: getLeaf
description: Find a leaf based using its data

name: findInTree
description: call the callback function on each node; returns the node if callback === true

content:
# tree
Vanilla drag-and-drop UI tree

## Rationale
I needed a tree components for my tools. Most of the available visual tree APIs require vue or react. And so yy-tree was created.

## Super Simple Example
```js
const data = {
    children: [
        { name: 'fruits', children: [
            { name: 'apples', children: [] },
            { name: 'oranges', children: [
                { name: 'tangerines', children: [] },
                { name: 'mandarins', children: [] },
                { name: 'pomelo', children: [] },
                { name: 'blood orange', children: [] },
            ] }
        ]},
        { name: 'vegetables', children: [
            { name: 'brocolli', children: [] },
        ] },
    ]
}

const tree = new Tree('.tree-div', data)
```

## Live Examples
https://davidfig.github.io/tree/

## API Documentation
https://davidfig.github.io/tree/jsdoc/

## Installation

    npm i yy-tree

## license
